title: Sweet Potato Chickpea Buddha Bowl
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C) and arrange sweet potatoes and onions on a baking sheet. Drizzle with oil, ensuring the flesh of the sweet potatoes are well coated and placed skin side down.
Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from oven, flip sweet potatoes, and add broccolini. Drizzle broccolini with oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for another 8-10 minutes, then remove from oven and add kale. Drizzle kale with oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for another 4-5 minutes then set aside.
While vegetables are roasting, heat a large skillet over medium heat. In a mixing bowl, toss chickpeas with cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, oregano, turmeric, salt, pepper, and oil.
Once skillet is hot, add chickpeas and sauté, stirring frequently, for about 10 minutes or until browned and fragrant. Remove from heat and set aside.
Prepare the tahini sauce by whisking together tahini, maple syrup, and lemon juice in a mixing bowl. Add hot water until a pourable sauce is formed. Set aside.
To serve, slice sweet potatoes into bite-sized pieces. Divide vegetables between serving bowls, top with chickpeas, and drizzle with tahini sauce.
